text: (upbeat music)

- Hi, I am Sandeep, a
Cloud Support Engineer
here at the AWS office in Cape Town.
Today, I'm going to walk you through
how to change your instance style.
As you can see, I am already logged in
to the AWS Management Console.
Open the Amazon EC2 console,
go to the instances,

select the instance
that you want to resize.
If you have launched your EC2 instance
from AMI without the custom Windows AMI,
all are Amazon provided Windows AMI
created before August 2018.
Install the required drivers
for the destination instance type.
The instance status checks will fail

if the instance doesn't
have the required drivers.

For more information, see
the Knowledge Center article
that's listed with this video.

Check to see if you have
any instance store volume.
You might need to back up data on them
as the data on them will be lost
when you stop the instance.
Instance store volumes are labeled
as a temporary storage drives
in my computer under Instance.

Keep in mind that if you don't
have an elastic IP address,
the public IP address will change
when the instance restarts
after the instance type is changed.

If your instance is an
EC2-Classic instance,
the private IP will change as well.
Now we are ready to stop the instance.

Choose Action, choose
Instance State, and then Stop.

When the instance is
stopped, choose Actions,
choose Instance Settings,
and then choose Instance Style.

Select desired instance
style from the list,
and then choose Apply.
Next, let's start the instance.

As you can see, the
instance type is changed.

Thanks for watching, and
happy cloud-computing
from all of us here at AWS.
